attributes.action: abolish the proposed law that will see alleged illegal filesharers disconnected from their broadband connections, without a fair trial
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This petition has been set up in response to the Government’s proposal to cut off internet access to those who are caught illegally downloading copyrighted files. We think this has one fundamental flaw, as illegal filesharers will simply hack into other peoples WiFi networks to do their dirty work. This will result in innocent people being disconnected from the internet. What's more, such a punishment should be dealt with in the proper way, in a court of law. This guilty until proven innocent approach violates basic human rights.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to abolish the proposed law that will see alleged illegal filesharers disconnected from their broadband connections, without a fair trial.

Her Majesty's Government has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.hmg.gov.uk/epetition-responses/petition-view.aspx?epref=dontdisconnectus


Her Majesty's Government
